intro: Licania pakaraimensis, commonly known as the Pakaraima licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Guyana Shield region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and produces small, clustered flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
